content.description: A short but pumpy and overhanging route. Start on edges, move up to a rail, then into jugs for a few moves. Work your way through some crimps and a gaston and you'll be at the lip in no time. Topout or lower off.
content.location: This route is fairly obvious on the overhanging face of the Mushroom boulder facing the Maple Run Wall.

content.description: A decent route that climbs a techy face. Start on the right side of the wall with the arete and face and climb straight up on crimps and crystals with a jug or two tossed in. Probably better as a toprope unless the original bolts get replaced!
content.protection: Beware the old bolts, but the anchor is new!
content.location: On the backside of the Mushroom boulder. Walk away from the Maple Run Wall and scramble up smaller boulders to reach the start of this climb. This is the righthand climb on the wall.

content.description: This small wall is actually a huge boulder. It contains a handful of sport routes and a couple of top-ropes.
